intro: Elatostema frutescens var. fuscifurfuracea, commonly known as the dark-leaved elatostema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, commonly known as the nettle family. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a dark, almost velvety texture. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. This variant is notable for its unique leaf coloration and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
